greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(1) = 0; after which, a(2n) = a(n), a(2n+1) = 1 + a(A250470(n)).
comment: Consider the binary tree illustrated in A252753 and A252755: If we start from any n, computing successive iterations of A253554 until 1 is reached (i.e., we are traversing level by level towards the root of the tree, starting from that vertex of the tree where n is located at), a(n) gives the number of odd numbers > 1 encountered on the path (i.e., excluding the final 1 from the count but including the starting n if it was odd).
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..8192
formula: a(n) = A080791(A252754(n)). [Number of nonleading 0-bits in A252754(n).]
a(n) = A000120(A252756(n)) - 1. [One less than the binary weight of A252756(n).]
xref: Powers of two, A000079, gives the positions of zeros.
Differs from A252735 for the first time at n=21, where a(21) = 1, while A252735(21) = 3.
results.author: _Antti Karttunen_, Jan 12 2015
